Description: Rim sherd of Attic red-figured pottery skyphos; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of head and chest of youth with short hair, to right (chest in three-quarter view); sketchy anatomical markings in dilute brown on chest; preliminary sketch on face and chest. Rim shows some wear.
Producer name: Attributed to: Painter of Louvre CA 1849
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1886,0401.1317 (E153.2). For parallels, see the skyphos, Paris, Louvre CA1849, Beazley Archive Vase Number 213322; skyphos fragments, Agrigento, Museo Archeological Regionale, Beazley Archive Vase Number 213329.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (E153.1)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XIII, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0356) (Phase 1)
